Issues.Title: Important selector strategy does not play well with ::-webkit-color-swatch pseudo class
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.3.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

postcss 8.4.24

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v20.0.0

**What browser are you using?**

N/A

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/sYr56p1Qdf

**Describe your issue**

I'm using a custom property to style the `::-webkit-color-swatch` pseudo-element. It works as expected when there isn't a selector added to the generated styles (see expected rendering at https://play.tailwindcss.com/1GvAsVM2yK), but if I add one (via `important: ".my-container"`) then those utility classes stop matching.

It appears to be an issue with the `.my-container :is(....)` wrapper that Tailwind is adding to the generated CSS. It outputs:

```css
.my-container :is(.\[\&\:\:-webkit-color-swatch\]\:border-none::-webkit-color-swatch) {
  border-style: none;
}
```

If that were to be 
```css
.my-container :is(.\[\&\:\:-webkit-color-swatch\]\:border-none)::-webkit-color-swatch {
  border-style: none;
}
```

Then it would match.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Important selector strategy does not play well with ::-webkit-color-swatch pseudo class" (#11435)

Issues.Title: Simplify browserslist setup by relying on `defaults`
Issues.Body:
This PR simplifies the browserslist setup we introduced last week.

Now we will just rely on `defaults` and `:is()` + `custom properties` support from browserslist. The explicit `:is` and `custom properties` features are important because those are needed to make Tailwind work in general.

<!--

üëã Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Simplify browserslist setup by relying on `defaults`" (#11412)

Issues.Title: Explicitly configure Lightning CSS features, and prefer user browserslist over default browserslist
Issues.Body:
This PR explicitly includes or excludes Lightning CSS features to ensure we have the best possible
output while maintaining backwards compatibility.

A few side effects that this PR includes:

1. We changed the default browserslist we ship in Tailwind itself
1. Tests had to be updated to reflect the changes in the include/exclude feature and the browserslist changes
1. Some Lighting CSS bugs popped up while updating the tests. Linking them here to keep track of them:
   1. https://github.com/parcel-bundler/lightningcss/issues/508
   1. https://github.com/parcel-bundler/lightningcss/issues/509
1. Added the ability to default to the browserlist of _your_ project if it is defined.

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->

Issues.Title: Move unknown pseudo elements outside of `:is`
Issues.Body:
We did a lot of refactoring previously to handle `::deep`, `::ng-deep`, and `::v-deep`. However, we also made the decision to preserve the position of unknown pseudo elements.

This has resulted in a bit too much churn. So we're hardcoding the list `::deep`, `::ng-deep`, and `::v-deep` for now. We do still, however, consider unknown pseudo elements to be "actionable" ‚Äî meaning they can have user-action pseudo-classes attached to them. We will move the pseudo element and attached classes as a group when moving elements.

Fixes #11331
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Move unknown pseudo elements outside of `:is`" (#11345)

Issues.Title: Make the Rust based parser the default
Issues.Body:
This PR fixes a few small things, but the main goal is to make the Rust parser the default parser.

- This PR also fixes an issue with candidates separated by comma's but without spacing. Such as
    `:class="['underline','font-bold']"`.
- This PR also makes sure that the TypeScript types for the experimental feature flags are correct.

Issues.Title: space-x-* doesn't work with flex-row-reverse
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** 3.3.2 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** none **What version of Node.js are you using?** css issue **What browser are you using?** chrome **What operating system are you using?** windows **Reproduction URL** ```
``` **Describe your issue** margin-left is non zero on divB but is not on divA. divA appears visually after divB so the margin-left should rather be on divA and not divB. Visually you don't get the expected space between because the margin in the middle is 0 and there's margin on the left of the first div for no reason. Same issue probably for flex-col-reverse and space-y-*. e.g. adding flex-row-reverse to the docs example gives this result because of the same issue. ![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/502496/d3734ba1-a79c-4d45-b80e-906c3a023814)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "space-x-* doesn't work with flex-row-reverse" (#11392)

Issues.Title: Ensure the oxide parser has feature parity with the stable RegEx parser
Issues.Body:
This PR ensures that the Rust based parser now extracts all the expected candidates that the RegEx based parser also extracts.

This will allow us to eventually switch to the Rust based parser by default.

There are a few caveats:

1. If a custom `transformer` or `extractor` is required for a file, then the RegEx based parser will be used for that file.
2. If a custom `separator` or `prefix` is used, then we fallback to the RegEx based parser.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Ensure the oxide parser has feature parity with the stable RegEx parser" (#11389)

Issues.Title: Bump `lightningcss` dependency
Issues.Body:
This PR bumps the `lightningcss` dependency + a bunch of cleanup in the tests.

Bumping the `lightningcss` dependency required me to change a few tests. However the tests were currently setup in a way to allow us to use both the `stable` and the new `oxide` parser.

Before we merged the 2 engines (https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/pull/11275), we had 2 engines. the `stable` engine which uses a RegEx based parser, and the `oxide` parser which is Rust based. The `oxide` engine also used Lightning CSS in the pipeline.

Because we used Lightning CSS in the pipeline of the oxide parser and not the stable parser, it meant that all our tests had slightly different output (because Lightning CSS can optimize a bunch of rules / properties). We didn't want to have an `if(engine === oxide)` check in every single tests, especially if we didn't touch those parts of the codebase. Instead we came up with another solution:

We use a custom `toMatchFormattedCss` Jest matcher, this allowed us to compare 2 CSS outputs in our tests. This matcher received both the `actual` and `expected` values. So as a solution, we parsed and re-printed both the `actual` and `expected` values, and then compared them.

This wasn't perfect becuase the actual CSS could have:
```css
.foo {
  background-color: #000;
}
```

And the expected CSS could be:
```css
.foo {
  background-color: black;
}
```

But since both CSS blobs were piped in Lightning CSS and then into Prettier, it meant that the final output is the same.

Fast forward to today, the engines are now merged and we always have Lightning CSS running. This also means that we don't have to re-parse everything and run it through Lightning CSS in order to compare the CSS outputs in our tests. Getting rid of the additional `lightningcss.format` step now always exposes the "real" output.

There are a lot of changed files, but they now do reflect reality based on what is actually produced. 

<!--

üëã Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Bump `lightningcss` dependency" (#11388)

Issues.Title: Arbitrary values in arrays not picked up
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.3.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

postcss 8.4.24, Next.js 13.4.4, react 18.2.0

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v20.1.0

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome, Safari, Firefox

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS 13.13.1 (a)

**Reproduction URL**

[Tailwind Play with repro](https://play.tailwindcss.com/UvHltQ4mfE). `from-black/[85]` appears in the snippet but does not appear in the css output.

```
[a:"[]]from-black/[85]
```

**Describe your issue**

I'm using a package of components that uses `cva` for some styles. The styles are sometimes structured like:

```tsx
export const imageOverlayClasses = cva(
  [
    'w-full',
    'bg-gradient-to-t',
    'from-black/[85]',
    'to-transparent',
  ]
)
```
Which is compiled to a `index.js` where the styles show up as `... dx=se(["w-full","bg-gradient-to-t","from-black/[85]","to-transparent"] ...`. For some reason, `from-black[85]` isn't picked up by tailwind, while `w-full`, `bg-gradient-to-t` and `to-transparent` is.

Makes me think that the regex is missing arbitrary styles when they're nested in brackets.

Might be related to #11241
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Arbitrary values in arrays not picked up" (#11387)

**Reproduction URL**

A Tailwind Play link or public GitHub repo that includes a minimal reproduction of the bug. **Please do not link to your actual project**, what we need instead is a _minimal_ reproduction in a fresh project without any unnecessary code. This means it doesn't matter if your real project is private/confidential, since we want a link to a separate, isolated reproduction anyways.

A reproduction is **required** when filing an issue ‚Äî any issue opened without a reproduction will be closed and you'll be asked to create a new issue that includes a reproduction. We're a small team and we can't keep up with the volume of issues we receive if we need to reproduce each issue from scratch ourselves.

Issues.Title: üö® [security] Update vite 4.3.4 ‚Üí 4.3.9 (patch)
Issues.Body:
üö® Your current dependencies have known security vulnerabilities üö® This dependency update fixes known security vulnerabilities. Please see the details below and assess their impact carefully. We recommend to merge and deploy this as soon as possible!
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è vite (4.3.4 ‚Üí 4.3.9) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/vitejs/vite) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/vitejs/vite/blob/main/packages/vite/CHANGELOG.md)
Security Advisories üö®

üö® Vite Server Options (server.fs.deny) can be bypassed using double forward-slash (//)

Summary

Vite Server Options (server.fs.deny) can be bypassed using double forward-slash (//) allows any unauthenticated user to read file from the Vite root-path of the application including the default fs.deny settings (['.env', '.env.*', '*.{crt,pem}'])

Impact

Only users explicitly exposing the Vite dev server to the network (using --host or server.host config option) are affected, and only files in the immediate Vite project root folder could be exposed.

Patches

Fixed in vite@4.3.9, vite@4.2.3, vite@4.1.5, vite@4.0.5
And in the latest minors of the previous two majors: vite@3.2.7, vite@2.9.16

Details

Vite serve the application with under the root-path of the project while running on the dev mode. By default, vite using server options fs.deny to protected the sensitive information of the file. But, with simply double forward-slash, we can bypass this fs restriction.

PoC

  1. Create a new latest project of vite using any package manager. (here I'm using react and vue templates for tested and pnpm)
  2. Serve the application on dev mode using pnpm run dev.
  3. Directly access the file from url using double forward-slash (//) (e.g: //.env, //.env.local)
  4. Server Options fs.deny restrict successfully bypassed.

Proof Images:

Release Notes

4.3.9

Issues.Title: SVG Takes full width view port when inside an Anchor tag
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.3.2 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Next.js 13.4.4 **What version of Node.js are you using?** For example: v18.16.0 **What browser are you using?** For example: Google, Brave, Microsoft Edge (Any Chromium based) **What operating system are you using?** Windows **Reproduction URL** https://github.com/DarioR01/tailwind-svg-bug **Describe your issue** https://github.com/DarioR01/tailwind-svg-bug **Describe your issue** Browser: Chromium based Browsers such as Chrome, Microsoft Edge, and Brave. When using any svg elements inside an anchor element tag Then the svg margin spans for the whole width of the view port Expected behaviour svg box retains its size and behaves like a block item with declared width and height and no margins. Below is a visual example of the issue: ![Bug](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss-intellisense/assets/90621252/5d10000c-fd9f-463e-8826-8cf12a62981a) This also happens in extremely minimal examples like as such: ```html ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "SVG Takes full width view port when inside an Anchor tag" (#11377)

Issues.Title: Style Conflict
Issues.Body: When I use tailwindcss, I will conflict with the primary type of buttons in the ant design element component library. I will turn the default blue color to white, and it will only turn blue when the mouse is moved over the button
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Style Conflict" (#11365)

Issues.Title: Why are there no group selectors?
Issues.Body:
Why can't I write for example lg:{flex p-10} or lg:[flex p-10]. Why, for example, when compiling, just do not divide by lg:flex and lg:p-10.
In fact, as I see it, the only problem with tailwind is adaptive or others like hover, because it's inconvenient to prescribe it. Estimate if you will have:
min-[320px]:text-center and you need to prescribe for each. Yes, you can take it out somewhere, but damn. The very essence is that because of tailwind, classes are already huge, and prescribing md to everyone: it's just a waste of time and symbols.

damn, well, it can be thought out somehow. Why, for example, md:flex md:p-10 does not prescribe 2 media requests? Probably because it is somehow implemented under the hood. I think there are a lot of ideas to come up with here and I would really like this feature to be added and then tailwind would have no equal
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Why are there no group selectors?" (#11360)

Issues.Title: Four digit hex fallback prevents ring from applying on Amazon Fire Stick Web Apps
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.1.7

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Next.js v13.2.4

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v16.14.2

**What browser are you using?**

Amazon Web App Platform which is based on Chromium - it's user agent is `Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 4.2.2; AFTB Build/JDQ39) AppleWebKit/537.22 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/25.0.1364.173 Mobile Safari/537.22 cordova-amazon-fireos/3.4.0 AmazonWebAppPlatform/3.4.0;2.0` - I got this from here - https://developer.amazon.com/docs/fire-tv/user-agent-strings.html


**What operating system are you using?**

For example: Fire TV Stick

**Reproduction URL**

Ring does not show when no shadow is applied - https://play.tailwindcss.com/6iOQjaIXWG

To fix you have to apply `shadow-sm` or `shadow-lg` etc (`shadow-none` does not fix it). Or you can add the CSS variable `--tw-shadow: 0 0 #000` and it fixes it.

Fix in playground - https://play.tailwindcss.com/p5vlrszF4U


**Describe your issue**

Making modern apps for Amazon Fire Stick allows using HTML to make packages. Their wrapper is based on Chromium.

I think the problem is that it does not understand the `#0000` four digit hex code. As the fix just turns that to three digit hex code.

To test this you can easily do so locally with a Fire TV Stick and installing the Web App Tester, and then creating a app and point it to the ip on your network where you are running locally.  Here are details - https://developer.amazon.com/docs/fire-tv/getting-started-with-web-apps.html#using-web-app-tester-and-devtools
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Four digit hex fallback prevents ring from applying on Amazon Fire Stick Web Apps" (#11359)

Issues.Title: not put classes from ts.
Issues.Body:
I want to create a directive and put classes dynamically. **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** For example: v3.3.2 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Angular For example: postcss-cli 8.3.1, Next.js 10.0.9, webpack 5.28.0 **What version of Node.js are you using?** For example: v18.11.0 **What browser are you using?** For example: Chrome **What operating system are you using?** For example: macOS **Reproduction URL** A Tailwind Play link or public GitHub repo that includes a minimal reproduction of the bug. **Please do not link to your actual project**, what we need instead is a _minimal_ reproduction in a fresh project without any unnecessary code. This means it doesn't matter if your real project is private/confidential, since we want a link to a separate, isolated reproduction anyways. A reproduction is **required** when filing an issue ‚Äî any issue opened without a reproduction will be closed and you'll be asked to create a new issue that includes a reproduction. We're a small team and we can't keep up with the volume of issues we receive if we need to reproduce each issue from scratch ourselves. **Describe your issue** I don't know why when I put classes like `
TEST
` but if I put like here `
TEST
` works very good. Can someone help with this issue? Describe the problem you're seeing, any important steps to reproduce and what behavior you expect instead.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "not put classes from ts. " (#11352)

Issues.Title: Circular dependencies when using the tailwind css class names
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

Tailwind v3.2.4
Buildtool: webpack 5.38.1, postcss-cli: v8.3.1
Node: 16.15.0
 macOS

**Reproduction URL**

[Tailwind play example](https://play.tailwindcss.com/h4TW33emvN?file=css)

**Describe your issue**

I want to change the appearance of a button depending on whether it is shown in a div with a particular background color. 
But this results in a circular dependency. Is there a way to do this? Or how do I go best about this?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Circular dependencies when using the tailwind css class names" (#11343)
